title: Roy Keane has Sky Sports studio not knowing where to look with brutal comment about Fred

Roy Keane had half the Sky Sports studio laughing and the other half looking away in shock with his brutally unexpected comment after Manchester United midfielder Fred.

The former Red Devils captain was discussing Tottenham's Christian Eriksen with Gary Neville, Graeme Souness and Jamie Carragher when he brought up the Brazilian.

Neville and Carragher were in agreement that Eriksen's performance levels have dropped after he failed to get a move away from Spurs in the summer transfer window.

The Denmark international was poor in the defeat by Liverpool, and Neville claimed this was yet another example of the midfielder not doing enough.

(Image: Sky Sports)

Neville added that despite this he believes top clubs would still be interested in signing Eriksen, and that his former club United would be among them.

Keane was then asked whether he would sign Eriksen if he was United boss, and gave a rather humorous and unexpected response.

"Not if I was the manager of Manchester United," said Keane on Sky Sports.

"I think he [Eriksen] will get a move on a free, but I don't think he'd improve those teams, and that's the key for clubs like Man United trying to close that gap.

(Image: Getty Images)

"He won't make Manchester United better, but having said that Man United bought Fred."

The comment was met with a few laughs while Neville did his best not to crack a smile and Souness moved the conversation on.
description: The former Manchester United captain was typically brutal while discussing Tottenham's Christian Eriksen
